data.title: Carillon Historical Park, Dayton
data.meta_description: Constructed in 1796, Newcom Tavern is one of the oldest buildings in Ohio. The two-story structure was initially used as school, store and it also served as a courthouse during the 18th Century. It was also converted into a museum in 1896, post which it was moved to its current address at Carillon Historical Park. The historic house is still open for visits, however, entry to its second floor is restricted.
